com.paypal.selion.configuration

Class ListenerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.paypal.selion.configuration.ListenerManager

  • public final class ListenerManager
extends Object
    TestNG 6.1 provides a capability wherein you can hook in Listeners via ServiceLoading. In order for you to leverage this capability, and also be able to dynamically enable/disable it from within your project , you would need to first register the listener with ListenerManager.
    • Use registerListener(ListenerInfo) to register your listener and then use
    • executeCurrentMethod(ITestNGListener) - to find if a current method within your listener should be invoked or skipped.
    For more details about ServiceLoader capabilities in TestNG refer here

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ENABLE_LISTENER_MANAGER
      This String constant represents the JVM argument that can be enabled/disabled to enable/disable ListenerManager to manage the listeners.
      static String THREAD_EXCLUSION_MSG

    • Method Detail

      • registerListener

        public static void registerListener(ListenerInfo information)
        Register your Listener using this method.
        Parameters:
        information - - A ListenerInfo object that contains information pertaining to your listener.

      • executeCurrentMethod

        public static boolean executeCurrentMethod(org.testng.ITestNGListener listener)
        This method decides if a TestNG interface implementation should be executed or skipped. The decision is made after checking if the current Listener enabled/disabled as determined by ListenerInfo.isEnabled().
        Parameters:
        listener - - A ITestNGListener object which represents your listener.
        Returns:
        - A flag which states if the current method is to be skipped or executed.
